There's actually more to this series. In seeing as this was uploaded 3 yrs and 8 months ago, it seems rather unlikely that they're looking to upload more so I think i'll just tell the ending for those who are curious. ! SPOILERS ! He builds a raft and makes his way to the island that he saw in the end here. There, he finds another group of natives living as he had found the first group. He decides to just assimilate into group peacefully and live out the rest of his days there. Time moves forward and he has lived to a ripe old age when the island is attacked by a swarm of the seal creatures except they seem to have evolved to grow extremely large and vicious ("large" as in elephant size). The final scene cuts to our world where the nerd guy from the beginning is in a car driving along a bridge and once again, the giant seal creatures swarm out of nowhere and begin wreaking havoc. They're lead by one creature which is being ridden by a man with purple hair.

Kinda sucks that his greed and jealousy sort of screwed it up. Like these people seemed fine really. The best food grows on trees, there are no dangerous predators, nor was there even competition for anything. It also wasn't ever cold and always day so it was always warm. Wish I could see an alternative where he assimilated to their customs or just their... sharing and caring sort of culture. Sure, he could've kept Bora at his side but that would just be it.

This more or less could be interpreted as the feudal lords overtaking Common land by force. This is warned by the English Diggers during the English Civil war. The only problem with the Diggers critique is that the productive forces have not developed enough to be able to fend off these feudal barons that MC represents. Under a non-primitive communist society it would be less susceptible to establishing or reestablishing class relations as all members of the Communist society will be up in arms by this egregious act of violence. Just as Common land was seized by force in England the common lands of the peach trees have been seized and converted into private property. I don't think this piece of art is suppose to glorify primitive communism but to outline its weaknesses to Violence and coercion, but at the same time highlight the beneficial social relationships that communism has on the people. Peace and Solidarity comrades.
